answers.author: Jerry Giaimis
answers.text:
Randolph, New Jersey started doing this a few years ago.  Prior to my current position I served there as the Assistant Township Manager.  I do not know of any cost benefit analysis done but I can tell you from an efficiency standpoint it was amazing.   Every council member, the attorney, manager and the assistant manager were provided a laptop with VPN connections so they could view the agenda and supporting documents from home.  Laptops were used at meetings and the only time a paper packet was prepared was for the press and a few interested parties from the public.  I couldn't answer questions about the transition because it was in place prior to my arrival but aside from the occasional minor computer glitch, we rarely had any problems.

text: Has anyone done the ROI or Cost/Benefit Analysis of going paperless for City Council Packets? Did you provide your Council with Laptops? I would appreciate any lessons learned from making the transition from paper to paperless
title: City Council - Paperless Agenda
